website_summaries.verdict: An excellent juicer that can also make nut butters, pasta, baby food, soy milk, and other foods.
pros: Low speed minimizes heat during extraction to preserve as many of the vitamins and nutrients as possible
Can be used for other kitchen tasks like food processing and grinding
Features stabilizing feet to prevent movement during operation
Automatic pulp ejection allows for continuous juicing
cons: Components are somewhat flimsy, including the screen filter, which can burst when certain fruits or vegetables are pushed through

customer_reviews.title: Avoid this!
customer_reviews.text: Has a fatal flaw in that it's screen filter bursts whenever wheat grass and several other things are processed through it....Buy the similar product that is vertical instead of horizontal
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Design.
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor read 1 star reviews on this juicer plastic screen that fits over auger self destructs in about 2 months or less. Replacement cost 130.00$ . It cannot handle the pressure going between it and the auger. Poor Design.
customer_reviews.author: johnny murray

customer_reviews.title: what a disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: juicer arrived damaged with loose parts/screws inside the unit. Accessories were also cracked. Amazon will not take it back so basically lost almost $285.. what a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: S. Pitaks

customer_reviews.title: I absolutely loved this item when it worked
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely loved this item when it worked. However, I juiced 6 tines and the plastic piece that grinds up the food wares down. Basically the more you use the item, the plastic files itself down. By using the product, it renders itself obsolete. I am sad to have to return this. It seems obvious to me now that one should not buy an item like this without the vendor making the parts out of metal. After about the 6th time of use, the pulp stopped coming out of the unit and the food just sat in the chamber like sludge because it cannot push the food out any longer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My best juicer
customer_reviews.text: I own 4 juicers. Omega, breville, Hurom, and tribest elite. Hurom and tribest both were over $500 And I hardly use them and they are my.least favorite. This omega was $300 when I purchased it back in 2013. 5 years later it still runs well and i havent had to replace any part yet. I REALISE THAT AS TIME PASSES , I GET TO LIKE MY OMEGA BETTER THAN THE REST. This juicer is compact and fits perfectly in my small kitchen. Also cleaning the OMEGA is veeery easy. I Love my Omega.
customer_reviews.author: Vegan world

customer_reviews.title: Great customer service
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this unit for about two weeks and already the motor is smoking and the juicing screen and auger have broken. We are longtime Omega customers and feel that our older model was built better. The customer service staff has been terrific and have replaced the products that have failed. They are friendly, patient and helpful. So, purchase your juicer with confidence knowing that if something breaks within the warranty period that you will be covered and the company will assist you. Thanks, Omega!
customer_reviews.author: TD Karantsalis

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Oemga J8006 juicer after reading the positive reviews. Unfortunately it hasn’t lived up to my expectations. Each time I use it to make apple juice, pieces of apple get stuck between the auger and the drum. I then have to disassemble all the juicing parts, clean them, put them back together an hope it works right. I feel like this juicer is very wasteful as well. End up using a lot of produce and don’t get much juice. This is is contrary to the reviews on Amazon, so maybe the piece I’ve got is defective. Tried to return the system, unfortunately Amazon doesn’t do replacements for the J8006. So I’m stuck with it I guess.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke after several uses, cheap piece of C
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I just missed the return and support window. The plastic cap cracked while making sorbet from frozen fruit. I'm willing to change my review if someone contacts me to replace the broken parts, but at this point seems I'm out a couple hundred bucks and SOL after buying this cheaply made POC. Very unhappy. Don't buy it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Carlitos

customer_reviews.title: Auger issues - wore off after first juicing of carrots and beets.
customer_reviews.text: On the first use the Auger started to wear out... the plastic on the teeth has given way, and shaved off. I have juiced carrots, beets, ginger. I am not sure now whether it just happened, or whether the auger was already damaged when I got it. I am going to send this back, unless Omega responds quickly.
customer_reviews.author: P Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Screen broked with the wheatgrass juicing
customer_reviews.text: Very sad to write this, the screen broked. The wheat grass seems to be too hard for this juicer, but then why should one purchase this costly juicer which is touted as the best juicer of wheatgrass. I seriously doubt that claim now. I am located outside of juicer, so I can even buy the replacement and ship it to my location. The Omega screen available in Amazon at 89$ is a duplicate ripoff.  Somebody is making tons of money from the miseries of Omega customers. Why is Omega itself sells in on Amazon at 28$ like they do in their website? This will help consumers outside of US to ship it internationally with reasonable shipping costs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Health Geek

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in May 2017, June 2018 and the parts are breaking already. And to buy a couple parts it almost costs as much as the juicer. I did like the way it juiced. Will never but this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the price
customer_reviews.text: My Breville centrifugal juicer finally conked out after years of heavy use. I decided to try a masticating juicer and what a difference! The juice doesn't separate, there is no pulp, and it tastes better. You do have to cut everything into small pieces but that is the Zen of making your own juice. While the Omega is a little pricier it can do so much more than just juice. I am looking forward to trying to make pasta and sorbet with it. The parts are all sturdy and I think it will last for years.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: I expected a very costly juicer like this to hold up much longer
customer_reviews.text: We bought our Omega in August 2017 and today 22nd of February 2018 the end cap broke, this unit while working was five star product, however due to this end cap breaking I will only give it 3 stars. Also the cost of replacing this unit on Amazon is highway robbery. I expected a very costly juicer like this to hold up much longer. Omega sells the end cap for 12.00USD but are sold out,it almost looks like somebody bought them all and sell them here for blood monies. I will be contacting Amazon about this product as it is not even one year old.
customer_reviews.author: Secret

customer_reviews.title: Omega juicer
customer_reviews.text: I have enjoyed this juicer for five years until the screen attachment cracked. I emailed the customer service gave them information....I patiently waited for a response, after some time, they finally responded that I needed to send a picture (not sure why my first picture didn’t go through) so I sent another picture, then didn’t here from them at all. I finally called them and was told the warranty wouldnt cover it because my screen was clogged. She said I needed to clean it with cascade dishwasher detergent. I wish that I would have known that a long time ago! Bottom line, I’m disappointed with their lousy customer service. Now I will have to look to buy a replacement part.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Great juicer. I have never had one but I had read the benefits of juicing in several articles and books. I went with the Omega because of the reviews and they were spot on. I can tell a huge difference in my energy levels and sleep patterns when I "juice." It seems a little pricey at first, but since I use it every day, the cost is so minimal. I have noticed a difference in my complexion as well. It's so hard to get the nutrients we need and this makes it so much easier for my husband and I. He loves his juice in the morning. Cleaning takes about 5 minutes. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dani

customer_reviews.title: International customer
customer_reviews.text: Terrible customer service. My juicer got burned after only two months of use. I emailed them, telling all the details after asking me where's my location, I didn't hear from them. I advise international customers to re-consider before buying from this company. Alas, for me it's too late and to think that I bought this to have a healthier diet now I'm stuck with a burned piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Soledad Maron

customer_reviews.title: Company customer service unresponsive
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been enjoying this juicer almost daily since purchasing in December, 6 months ago. Unfortunately one part of the grinder broke and I have been trying for two weeks to get a hold of the company in order to discuss the warranty or purchase a replacement part. I’ve emailed 4 times and attempted to call on multiple occasions with ZERO response. The juicer has been great, the service from Omega is non-existent. Their phone system doesn’t seem to work at all. Very frustrating as I juice daily.
customer_reviews.author: McCarol

customer_reviews.title: Great juicer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this juicer. Years ago I had one of the cheap juicer machines that was really loud and produced foamy, hot almost undrinkable juice. But this machine produces almost foam free and relatively cool juice. The motor is also fairly quiet. I've been juicing once a day since I got it. The only downside, and this would be true for any juicer, is that it takes a while to wash and juice the produce and then clean it all up. But doing this once a day for my health isn't too much to ask, and fresh juice beats the pre-made green juices in the grocery store which are undrinkable and nasty tasting.
customer_reviews.author: JustMyOpinion

customer_reviews.title: Everything is made of plastic.  This won't last.
customer_reviews.text: The motor is very strong. The functionality is okay. It juices greens well, but struggles with fibrous vegetables due to clogging. It is far quieter than a $40 centrifugal juicer, but also clogs more often. I can't say it's a good value or even a reasonable purchase. What you recover in juice you lose in time due to constant break down for cleaning. Unfortunately, all of the stressed parts are plastic and deform under normal use. There is no way this item can withstand this type of fatigue for long.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Impressed
customer_reviews.text: I love to juice but have had trouble in the past with fresh ginger and turmeric root. So, I did my homework and settled on this one. It's been 3 months and I'm very happy. It works by crushing instead of grating like most juicers. It easily tears through fresh fruits and vegetables including ginger and turmeric. The only negative I could see someone experiencing is the fact that the chute is small. Therefore, the fruits and vegetables need to be cut a little smaller than with other juicers. I personally don't mind and think it's well worth the end product.
customer_reviews.author: Mom G

customer_reviews.title: A kitchen essential for anyone seeking higher health
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been the best at incorporating leafy greens into my diet, which is crucial for good health. My Omega has changed that for good! It juices greens like a dream and I drink my greens almost daily now! I feel a difference in my energy and overall well-being. Let me also say, if you’ve used other juicers and felt annoyed and/or frustrating by using them, fear not!!! This is NOTHING like traditional juicers and worth every penny. Assembles, cleans, and disassembles so quick and easily—this was always my biggest problem with other “cheap” juicers. My Omega will always be a kitchen staple. Some of the best money I’ve ever spent, hands down.
customer_reviews.author: Madison

customer_reviews.title: Worked well at first. Great product. Until it wasn't....
customer_reviews.text: It's now loud. The pump builds up. Little juice comes out. The pulp also remains wet. It squeals. Other people have complained about this, yet nothing has been done? For $260??? Once I finish my juicing, this thing is going back. Shame. Could have been great. Also, the intact is TINY, and unless you're putting things in one piece at a time, it gets stuck.
customer_reviews.author: Jamesbiz

customer_reviews.title: Buy the newer model
customer_reviews.text: I had the newer model before (moving across country) and accidentally ordered the older model this time, but decided to try it anyway. The newer model is well worth the extra money. The feed tube is wider and carrot slices don't get jammed. The older model needs veggies and fruits chopped even smaller. But if you want to juice frequently, the amount of chopping you have to do is quite a bit of work and can be a deterrent to juicing.
customer_reviews.author: jp t.

customer_reviews.title: No returns!
customer_reviews.text: I juicer does the job but with 2 little kids I wanted a juicer that could get the job done a little faster. I found a juicer I liked better but when I went to return this one Amazon wouldn’t let me return it. It says I have 30 days to return it but when I tried it said the product is not eligible for a return. My warning is that with so many juicers out there make sure you see it in action before you buy it because it is a lot of money out the door if you aren’t fully satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Becker

customer_reviews.title: broke after a couple of months
customer_reviews.text: one month outside return period. need to contact customer service. the juicing screen (plastic) just cracked. not sure how well made the plastic parts are. normal usage.
customer_reviews.author: adz

customer_reviews.title: Hands down the perfect juicer.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd juicer. I went with one of the higher rated 100.00 models and while it did make juice it would clog up at the pulp discharge and the juice would need a second strain. Not this bad boy. I was able to juice for 3 days worth without ever slowing down. There is a secondary strainer right under the juice outlet which saves me the whole step from above. It has never clogged even with celery which the other juicer just couldn’t handle. As far as cleaning it’s a breeze. I can break the whole machine down clean and reassemble in 5 min. I am very satisfied with this juicer
customer_reviews.author: Mike Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: OMG I love this machine! It's fantastic!!! The juice is so incredibly fresh!! Worth the investment. I just started using it a few days ago. It's a bit slower than my old juicer but it's a (pressed) masticating juicer so it should be. Very easy to assemble, use, disassemble & wash. As others said, just wash immediately after and it's no problem at all - takes about 2 minutes. They also provide a large toothbrush to clean the mesh. So far it has done all my greens well: spinach, kale, celery, cilantro, power greens, apple, watermelon (tomato got a bit mushy), onions. I haven't tried wheatgrass or any other fruit but will soon. This machine is great!
customer_reviews.author: Miki Baby

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I did much research prior to purchasing a juicer. This particular juicer does not do well with soft fruits such as mango and pineapple. One primary piece of the juicer broke after 32 days of purchase. Unfortunately, I now must go through the manufacturer for replacement parts. I am not sure how stressful and lengthy that process will be. I have used the juicer 4-6 times over this last month and I am disappointed a main part of the equipment has already broken.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael

customer_reviews.title: Love it...... Buy it, you won’t be sorry
customer_reviews.text: I have cancer and need a lot of nutrition. I decided to get that nutrition through juicing. We use this every day to juice about 5 pounds of vegetables and fruits, from beets through oranges and greens. This thing just turns it all into juice. We also made almond milk and fruit sorbets with it. Absolutely delicious. Unlike these high speed grinding juicers, this machine makes a much clearer juice, no foam and no fiber, just the nutrition. I highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: A. Luegger

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Does what all the good reviews say it does
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous at spending so much as I wanted this mainly for fruit. My nervousness was unfounded. I have been very pleased with the amount of juice I get from oranges, apples, and pineapples. The fibers can build up but if I drop pieces slowly and give a few seconds in between them it seems to be fine. I have not stopped to clean in the middle of juicing and had no problems. Pomegranate it does amazing. I never buy pomegranate as I hate the seeds. This machine extracts all the juice and spits out a dry pomegranate seed pulp. Clean up is easy. Pull apart 4 pieces and rinse.
customer_reviews.author: TM800

customer_reviews.title: Best decision
customer_reviews.text: I had a centrifugal juicer, but after a year of daily use, it gave out. I purchased this one and love it! Easy to assemble, disassemble, and wash. Does a great job on leafy items such as kale and spinach.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Beviano

customer_reviews.title: Eh. Don't know, guys. Expensive. Not great for price.
customer_reviews.text: You have to cut up the fruits and veggies... very small. The noise is quieter than other juicers but still enough to make you want to invest in ear plugs. This is because you will be sitting in front of it for a very long time. It's a slow juicer, so maybe that's to be expected, but a great deal of pulp gets stuck in the large plastic tube area.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with durability, functionality and ease of use and clean-up!
customer_reviews.text: Best juicer I've ever used. Masticating juicer is the way to go! We've used this particular machine for a few years now. It still functions like new. Easy to break down and rinse clean or put parts in the dishwasher. Easy to use. You will need to quarter apples and cut cucumbers in half lengthwise, but most large carrots and celery stalks fit without issue. I find if I wash and cut the produce the night before, my husband can juice about a quart to a half-gallon of juice in around 20-30 minutes. We freeze what we don't drink in the same day for a week's use.
customer_reviews.author: S. and D. Ledford

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed. Have only had for 3-4 months and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Have only had for 3-4 months and the pressure cut up raw beets put on the drive train blew out the housing at the end of the securing circular clamp. So cheap. Just wasted $350. :-(
customer_reviews.author: George in Seattle

customer_reviews.title: Great juicer
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy using this but I feel like the pulp doesn’t come out bone dry like I was hoping. It juices really fast. I’m loving the ability to juice at home instead of spending so much money at local shops. I looked at this for months before buying. It’s easy to assemble and clean and so far no issues so speak of other than it not pulling out every single drop of juice I think it could. Such a big investment but I’m saving money in the long run!
customer_reviews.author: Carol R.

customer_reviews.title: Love this juicer
customer_reviews.text: Love this juicer! I've owned juicers before, and this one is the best by far. Not only is it a coffee grinder, pasta maker, food processor and juicer all-in-one, but it literally takes a few minutes to take apart, clean and reassemble. It's well-designed, the motor is super quiet (I can juice while talking on the phone) and the parts are sturdy and durable. I may buy a few more of these as gifts... the juice has been delicious!
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Delish, Fantastic Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been waiting to write my review so I could get use to the juicer. Now that I have had it for several weeks - I have fallen in love all over again. The juicer is small in size, easy to clean and to store. It is not bulky in the least bit. The juicer blends all types of veggies, fruits down to the smooth liquid I was hoping for. My only complaint is the size of the feeder. It is tiny but I realize there is a reason for this and it helps to juice all ingredients perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Carol T. Parker

customer_reviews.title: THE juicer!!! Life-changing device!
customer_reviews.text: I got a juicer on the recommendation of a friend to juice fresh organic celery for detox (must drink within 1/2 hour to one hour after juicing for maximum benefit). I bought this in November 2017, and have used it virtually every day since. I detox from time to time, but use for other vegetable juice combos and for fruit juices, including cantaloupe and apple. I juice apples as a base for my smoothies, especially since I cannot have any yogurt or dairy products. This is a breeze to clean; I always clean it immediately after use, so nothing every dries on it. You will not regret this purchase. It's truly been life-changing for me.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Will Never Use Another!
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why I ever considered any other masticating juicer. This is the juicer my mother used when I was growing up, and it's the juicer that my roommate of 9 years let me use when we lived together. Although I made the mistake of trying a centrifugal juicer and then a cheaper masticating juicer from other companies, those mistakes just confirmed that this juicer is worth the money. You do have to prep larger veggies/fruits to be able to feed them through the chute, but clean up is a breeze, and there is a lot less moisture in the pulp as compared to other juicers I have tried. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: DanaM

customer_reviews.title: Reviews were right!
customer_reviews.text: I really love the juice that comes from this masticating juicer. But I have been a juicer before so when I say it seems to take longer to cut the juice ingredients due to a smaller shoot. It extracts all the liquid out of each and every fruit and the clean up is much faster than my other juicer which was more wasteful but was a Centrifugal juicer.
customer_reviews.author: D.J.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: I excitedly recieved my juicer, put it together and found that the Auger (the portion of the juicer that does the actual juicing) is defective! To add even MORE disappointment, this item is not eligable for return!?! My own slip up for not catching that prior tto my purchase, but SERIOUSLY????...this is nearly a $300 machine! and NOT being able to return it is absolutely ridiculous!
customer_reviews.author: Genie Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money...
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as it was recommended for juicing celery. It was awful. It would mush up the celery but it only extracted half of the juice. I had to then squeeze it through a separate strainer. Mess to clean as well. Complete waste of money. Amazon refunded thankfully.
customer_reviews.author: Lpetulla

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. Masticating juicers are supposed to provide more juice from your produce than centrifugal juicers. I did a side by side comparison with my $70 centrifugal juicer I got at Walmart using the same amount of produce. They produced the same amount of juice. I should have saved my money.The only reason this one is slightly better is that it's quieter. I could have brought a lot of produce for the cost of this juicer.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Good Slow Juicer
customer_reviews.text: Opening to drop fruits/ veggies is very small, takes a lot of prep time to get them chopped for juicing. Despite that I love the juicer, I get a lot more juice out of this juicer compared to my previous high speed juicer. The juice tastes much better. Can easily juice smaller veggies, roots, leaves, herbs Etc to make a healthy juice blend. This was not possible with previous high speed juicer. Good investment for the health freaks out there.
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: It's easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: After researching prior to purchase, I was cautious after reading some of these 1 star reviews. This juicer is an absolute power house which will take on anything you throw at it. The leftover pulp is completely dry. It's easy to clean. I have never felt better and my blood pressure has dropped dramatically. The Omega J8006 is one of the best purchases I've ever made.
customer_reviews.author: J. P.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!
customer_reviews.text: New to juicing and this is the 2nd juicer I have purchased. When I started juicing, I really had nothing to compare the machine to, and I relied on Amazon reviews to help me. That machine was returned as the motor was not working so well. The Omega juicer, however, is 100 times better than the other brand I had purchased. Now I have something to compare and I see spending a little more is certainly worth it. 15 year warranty is awesome as well.
customer_reviews.author: Lynniepoo

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE my Omega Juicer!
customer_reviews.text: I have many chronic health issues, and have been tackling them head-on. Juicing is a great way to get true wholesome nutrition to work in the body. I wanted the best, and this one truly ranks up there for me. As a cold-press process, you get the most juice, driest pulp, and best tasting juice from your ingredients. I've tried several others, and honestly won't go back. The Omega does many other things, however this is the main use I have for it. It's easy cleanup, no blades, and has a permanent place in my kitchen!
customer_reviews.author: The CommonWealth Shoppe

customer_reviews.title: Other than that small detail it works just great and have had no problem
customer_reviews.text: I would have given it 5 stars but the auger show some signs of wear after some fibrous roots such a turmeric and ginger. the once sharp grooves at the extraction end have become rounded after uses. I will keep an eye on it. Other than that small detail it works just great and have had no problem. It juices everything I put in the beast. The other thing is that you HAVE TO CUT UP your fruit and veggies to fit the tube or they get stuck, this take a little time but it's not big deal for me, just saying. It extracts plenty of juice and over all I am really pleased with the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzard

customer_reviews.title: Omega Does Not Honor Their Warranty
customer_reviews.text: The juicer worked at first. Then it began to make an obnoxiously loud clicking sound. I have contacted the Omega customer service department several times by email. No response. When I've called, I've been on hold between 20-30 minutes without speaking to any customer service rep. If you purchase this juicer, I would STRONGLY suggest that you buy the SquareTrade protection plan that Amazon offers.
customer_reviews.author: Dorinda F. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! For the people fussing about clean-up....how much faster do you need??!! It's easy and simple people! Works well! Very sturdy. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: What an excellent machine!
customer_reviews.text: WOW!!This is a Must have and Must BUY!!! What an excellent machine!! We use it everyday!! Love it!! Very EASY to use and it is EASY to clean. Make sure you clean it as soon as you are through using it. Its quiet and it does not take a long time to make your juice. Its a lot of fun and I would recommend getting a juicing recipe book. I have The Juice Lady's Big Book of Juices by Cherie Calbom. You will not be dissatisfied with this purchase. Thanks to the person who wrote the Super long review. He sold me!!
customer_reviews.author: shoebabe

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Strong, as advertised, and marvelous, responsive customer service. We purchased this juicer four and a half years ago and have used it at least 5 days a week for the last 4 1/2 years--so pretty much daily use. We bought it because of the 15 year warranty and the good reviews. We have not been disappointed. Our strainer developed a slight crack in it and I emailed customer service. They responded immediately and in less than a week we had our replacement part. No hassle. We also chose this masticating juicer over the centrifugal juicers because we wanted to juice greens and it has done a great job! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Marigold

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Look forward to juicing everytime. Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely LOVE our juicer and can't say enough great things about this one. It's our first juicer we have ever owned and we aren't disappointed. It squeezes out produce wonderfully. It's quiet. Easy to assemble, clean, and use. My kids enjoy helping and it has brought our health to a new level. Our skin is improving big time. Even after only using it for 2 weeks. We feel better and kids get micronutrients in so easily. Nothing better than feeding your family quality and pure foods by the cup:)
customer_reviews.author: Krystin C. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Shocking
customer_reviews.text: I DO love this thing - I bought it 5 years ago and only use it about 6-8 times a year. BUT today while turning it off I got shocked! I can't see anything visible to cause this, still looks brand new. I'm not sure what to do? Had this review up for a couple months - no reply.
customer_reviews.author: Rural Pa. Mom

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean & QUIET
customer_reviews.text: This machine is awesome! It’s exactly what I wanted & worth the price. It’s very user friendly, makes juicing so simple. I’ve been making celery, ginger, greens & lemon juice daily, wonderfully fresh & tasty. Also have done apple & citrus juice for my kids which they’ve loved. The best part? It’s easy to clean! I can get all pieces cleaned and put away in under 3 minutes. You can take it apart and soak it if you don’t want to take the time to clean it immediately. It’s also very, very quiet. Overall a great machine.
customer_reviews.author: AmartiO

customer_reviews.title: One of the best juicers on the market
customer_reviews.text: I've had this juicer for almost 4 years now. I've owned other masticating juicers. This by far is the easiest to use because of quickly you can set it up and clean it afterwards. The pulp is usually quite dry which means its effective at juicing. One thing I do wish was the pulp dispenser was on the side and that the machine was a little quieter.
customer_reviews.author: Apoorv Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Wheatgrass juicer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased mainly for juicing wheatgrass. Grass still needs to be pushed down into juicer feed tube but does the job right. So glad I didn't have to buy a hand cranked juicer as I have carpel tunnel and that wouldn't have been easy for me to do. There are more expensive models that might do a better job (spending $500-$1,000). But for our budget- this is the machine to go to! Happy purchase.
customer_reviews.author: diane florynski

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Works great from day 1. I’ve. Given up juicing with other juicers because of cleaning. This cleans in a breeze! Thank goodness! Just rinse and the pulp comes off. The. I soak a few minutes, use the brush included and it’s done! This was a big deal to me when I got this juicer. The juice is terrific and the machine is easy to use. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Somebody's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Great juicer!
customer_reviews.text: I spent a lot of time researching juicers before purchasing this particular one. Wow! I just spent 3 hours juicing for the next day for 2 people. I did give it a break every 30 minutes as instructed. I made 12 18ounces jars for the next day without any problems. The juice is delicious and the pulp is dry as expected. All I can say is this juicer proved itself the very first day and when calculating how much it cost, I spent $11 per person for 6 18oz servings. That's amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey K.

customer_reviews.title: Easy and does the job!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended by someone who owns a restaurant. I purchased it without checking reviews, Some were pretty bad and I am shocked!! I absolutely love it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Greatest juicer ever
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!! I didn't realize a juicer could be this great! Bought this to juice fruit grown in our garden to make wine. Our first project was pears. We were hoping to get a gallon of juice and we got 5 gallons from this magical appliance plus there are still pears on the tree. This juicer is so efficient, the rinds come out dry! Before I purchased I watched YouTube videos and was so impressed. I am so pleased with this juicer and have many plans for it. LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.author: janice s

customer_reviews.title: New to juicing, but
customer_reviews.text: We did not want the hassle of being forced to juice every day, so invested in this masticating juicer. (allows one to safely store juice for 3 days with no loss of nutrients if you adhere to food safety rules) According to previous reviews, the Omega also received high marks for ease of cleaning, and we find that to be true. One negative is the manual - if you are a newbie juicer it is not at all helpful! We invested in the cookbook "Juicing with the Omega Juicer", found on Amazon, and it has been worth every penny, allowing us to get the most out of this investment. 0verall, we are very pleased and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: sophiegirl

customer_reviews.title: Six weeks in the strainer split in two... Manufacturer refuses to send a replacement
customer_reviews.text: Broke after six weeks... I can't get Omega to send a replacement part. Worked great, while it worked. Lots of juice easy to clean. The funnel / strainer piece cracked while juicing a piece of lemon so I emailed the manufacturer. I identified the model, described the part (there are only four)... and they proceeded to ask for a picture. Okay, I obliged, send a photo of the cracked part (split down the middle really)... now crickets. I have emailed two more times... I work heads down 12 hours a day so I don't have time to call during business hours. I suppose that I could try to send back to Amazon..of course I threw out the box!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Conley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing juicer
customer_reviews.text: This thing makes amazing juice. Way better tasting than my centrifugal juicer. Also I noticed that when I juice multiple veggies or fruits they don't separate like they do with my centrifuge one. I bought this in 2014 and it still works in 2017 and I'm about to buy another for my mom
customer_reviews.author: Tyler L.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a beast at juicing vegetables, especially root veggies. Clean up is made easier due to the fact the parts are high quality. If treated right, it will definitely last longer than a centrifugal juicer.
customer_reviews.author: Cal Hockley Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Great juicer worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Great masticating juicer. It's expensive but worth it. You want all the nutrients and juices out of your fruits and vegetables that you run through this thing. I don't use it that often now but when I take it out the cabinet and use it I'm never disappointed in the juice it produces. Pulp is bone dry, which is the way it should be.
customer_reviews.author: PaniniChowder

customer_reviews.title: Good product but came with spider nest in it
customer_reviews.text: Juicer is great. However, when I took it out of the box and put it on my countertop several small jumping spiders came out and now I’ve been having to catch them all over my kitchen. Every time I use it at least one more comes out. :( this experience feels like it’s straight out of a nightmare. The juicer works great and I would give it a 5 star review if it weren’t for these spiders.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Rain

customer_reviews.title: Definitely recommend this juicer.
customer_reviews.text: This was my second juicer, and my first masticating. I love this product! It's heavy duty enough for home use and can take any raw veggie I put in it. It has a small chute, so veggies need to be cut smaller, but, for me, that's not an issue. Easy to take apart and clean; even comes with its own brush to make thorough cleaning possible. Can't say enough good.
customer_reviews.author: Organic mom

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and clean
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a workhorse. Carrots, ginger and beets juiced with no problem. It’s a bit interesting to get softer fruit like blueberries and strawberries to go through, as well as spinach. Just make sure to follow softer things with sturdier veggies. Super easy to assemble and clean. Overall very happy with purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed because I have read so many good reviews about ...
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it was just the item I received or what, but after using it a few times and within one week of purchase, it began to shoot the veggies and fruit back up the shoot it went down! So disappointed because I have read so many good reviews about it.
customer_reviews.author: Falastinia

customer_reviews.title: Wish I had bought it sooner
customer_reviews.text: I waited one month after buying this to give it a review because I wanted to make sure it was all I hoped it would be. It is so much more than what I expected. I have a Juiceman Juicer that has worked well for years, but the Omega Masticating Juicer is 100 times better. Not only is it easier to use, but it is so easy to clean. I am very pleased and highly recommend it. It is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: P Miller

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: I use the product for juicing. It said you could easily make ice cream. You have to let the frozen fruit thaw some but it works. Juicing grass takes a lot longer but it works. I haven’t tried almond butter or almond milk. Favorite is starting with cold veggies still have cold juice.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Sims

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and efficient
customer_reviews.text: This juicer makes juice from leafy greens, which my old Jack Lalane juicer only shredded. I also used apples, ginger, lemon, carrots. Pulp comes out nice and dry. It is also so easy to clean and it’s quiet while working. I love this juicer.
customer_reviews.author: Marzena

customer_reviews.title: I can't live without this juicer!!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased this for both myself and as a gift after much research on cold-pressed juicing, and its benefits over 'centrifugal' juicers. It has been an awesome addition to my lifestyle, as I seek nutrient dense foods and beverages. This is not only a juicer, but also a pasta extruder and a food processor---so it has a multitude of purposes. The Omega J8006 is built very well and sturdily with stainless steel versus plastic. It's worth every single cent. Some of my favorite juices: My "Green" Juice, spiked with Cayenne Pepper; Watermelon Mint; Apple-Cinnamon; Carrot Ginger.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy B.

customer_reviews.title: Great investment for your health.
customer_reviews.text: Love this Juicer. Yes it takes a little longer to prep but this thing rocks. I have both a centrifugal juicer and the J8006. The color is the biggest difference. This is differently for greens but it also does an awesome job with a lot of hardy fruit. The price is well worth is weight in gold. I have only been using this for a few weeks but I love it. It has changed my eating habits. I also believe that with the assurance that I am getting the most out of everything I put in it, I can be safe in saying it will pay for itself in years to come. Good investment in my book.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite small kitchen appliance!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this juicer for 2 weeks now to juice for 3 adults. Week 1 we ate and juiced; week 2 we are juicing only. This machine has made excellent, fresh, vegetable/fruit juices! I love that you get tiny particles of pulp in the juice, and the bigger pulp is mostly dry. Hard produce tends to produce the driest pulp, while softer produce tends to produce less dry pulp. This juicer has exceeded my expectations thus far. Will update my review in a few months with a more appropriate durability review.
customer_reviews.author: kris franks

customer_reviews.title: Seven years later and still going!
customer_reviews.text: Listen up!! Ive had mine for seven years now. Had to replace the cone twice, but still an amazing juicer. We juice at minimum once a week, and sometimes as much as three times a week. Not as die hard as some of you out there but enough that it proves this machine is built to go the long haul! Some tips!! If you have left over juice! Freeze it into ice cubes dont let it set over night in fridge! It breaks down in the fridge! So make some ice cubes! When your ready for another shot just drop ice cubes into a blender and add some fresh juice choice! Lots you can do with the ice cubes!
customer_reviews.author: L. Beauchamp

customer_reviews.title: Good for hard veggies and greens
customer_reviews.text: Celery sticks, lettuce bunches, cucumbers, carrots, and beets, and apples -- works great Oranges -- are generating too much soft pulp, and that is not coming out easily. Pineapple -- aahh, doesnt work that good Ginger -- Very Good Trick is to cut the fruits into 2 inch pieces, which you will know by time. Yeah it is time taking to prepare the produce, before switching on the juicer. Pulp is really dry, and the juice tastes delicious. Less noice, Easy to clean, and looks great !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good juicer with it's limitations.
customer_reviews.text: With the exception of softer fruits and vegetables, (including some apples) this machine has done well with just about everything I've thrown at it. It did however overheat juicing a large quantity of grapes after about twenty minutes of continuous use. Unit began to smell of smoke and became extremely hot to the touch before I realized what was going on. Aside from this, I am happy with the juicer, but it cannot be continuously run for any extended period of time, even when juicing something as soft as grapes. It's got a LOT of motor, but doesn't seem to be wired sufficiently to back it up for any sustained period of time.
customer_reviews.author: J. Neill

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first juicer I've ever owned and we love it! We just got it yesterday so the only thing we have juiced is carrots and apples. I read lots of reviews and I had in my head it was going to be a slow process when it came to making juices but I really am impressed with how quick I can juice 5lbs of carrots! It's quiet and I think it's easy to clean. I am very impressed with it!
customer_reviews.author: Tbonia

customer_reviews.title: Yes it is the Best Juicer
customer_reviews.text: After using a J. Lalanne power juicer for 9 months, I did research and realized the mastecating juicer is so much better. There are a lot of great machines out there, but Amazon's great price, along with outstanding reviews I finally rec'd the J8006. After 2 weeks of use I am sorry I didn't buy it sooner. Yes you need to slice and dice everything smaller, but we juice every day and now I make enough for 2 days, so don't have to do it every morning. The J8006 is really an outstanding juicer, clean up is simple and easy. The warranty is great and hopefully will never need to use it. Great work Omega!
customer_reviews.author: bravmo

customer_reviews.title: fabulous
customer_reviews.text: This juicer is as fabulous as I thought it would be. Fresh juices just exactly the way I want them in my own kitchen is heaven on earth. Cheaper than a juice bar! This machine is built for the long haul. It is tough, strong and efficient. And by efficient I mean there's no juice left in the anything that makes it past the grinder, it all goes into the juice bin for your enjoyment. It's easy to use, and clean-up is easier than I thought it would be. It's already paid for itself after only a few months, as I juice almost every day. Carrot-beet-spinach-ginger with a splash of lime! Oh yeah!
customer_reviews.author: snazzmo

customer_reviews.title: So versatile
customer_reviews.text: Love how sturdy this machine is. I was a little worried from some of the reviews I was reading but everything holds up well and i've used it every day for the past 2 weeks with no fail. I've been juicing celery every morning and will definitely try the pasta recipes with the different parts. would definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: Laveevee4u

customer_reviews.title: ... almost two years now and I can say it's amazing, powerful
customer_reviews.text: I've had this juicer for almost two years now and I can say it's amazing, powerful, you can get the good thing out the veggies or fruits. With Wheatgrass works perfectly. I had a problem with one part of the machine and the incredible service responded and honored the warranty. I highly recommend this
customer_reviews.author: Raquel Inoa

customer_reviews.title: Dependaple juicer
customer_reviews.text: The perfect juicer for my chemo journey. I juice carrots eveyday. The assembly, cleaning and reassmbly for the next day is easy. Great for the price. I decided to buy this one for the price and the 15 year watranty. It dors just what I need for whete I am at.
customer_reviews.author: V

customer_reviews.title: Best juicer on the market....
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean, a little expensive, but if you are a serious juicer, this is your machine.
customer_reviews.author: John H.

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to clean, as promised!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about the cleaning process for leafy greens like kale or also celery, because I had bad experiences with other juicers before. Dealing with clogged elements almost discouraged me from juicing for a while. I had done a lot of research and decided to try this juicer. I am very happy to share that it's very easy to clean, it doesn't clog up like others! Furthermore, the slow process appears to maximize the amount of juice you get. I've tried everything from apples to leafy greens, to carrots, and had no problems with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Melvin

customer_reviews.title: Highly reccomend
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic juicer. I use once a day and it is holding up nicely. This is very easy to clean (that was the biggest complaint I heard about juicing machines), taking only a few minutes. I have juiced everything from beets, sweet potatoes to kale and spinach. It seems to squeeze out every drop of juice while leaving behind the pulp (very dry pulp). I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Steck

customer_reviews.title: Best Juicer I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd juicer I've bought and this one is the best yet. The first 2 I bought were centrifugal juicers but this one far exceeds those. It does a great job on all fruit and veggies I like to juice. My recipe consists of the following: - Carrots - Kale - Apples - Celery - Beets - Cucumber - Lemons - Ginger Really great mix. Just have to find the right proportions for your taste. The best thing about this juicer it take only 2-3 minutes to clean up. The one negative is that the chute is very small but it's an easy one to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: Anjeanette Jeanfreau

customer_reviews.title: A Winner
customer_reviews.text: An excellent juicer that is easy to clean. It is large and heavy, but probably if it were lighter it would move around on the counter. I usually put my veggies through two or three times so I don't waste any of the juice. Organic vegetables are not cheap even if you grow them yourself. Usually I juice kale, carrots, and beets. It extracts well from celery and does wheat grass too. Another little trick is to put some filtered water through at the end to get even more from whatever you've put through previously.
customer_reviews.author: Ima Critic

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well built, quality juicer
customer_reviews.text: After a lot of consideration, I'm really glad I ended up with this omega. Pro's: Built like a tank (feels like it will last 20+ years) much quieter than other juicers very efficient juice extraction very high quality juice (minimal oxygen introduced) Useful for multiple purposes: on the "food processor" mode it is like a giant mortar and pestle that crushes everything. Try frozen bananas, frozen cherries cocoa nibs, almonds, vanilla and yogurt. Haven't made pasta yet, but I've heard it works well. The best juicer for greens con's: Slow (smaller opening, slower to process produce). You can't process soft fruit without extra thought (freeze them, or follow them with something firmer that will push the juice out)
customer_reviews.author: Tristan Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Juicer
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only used it for juicing but I LOVE THIS JUICER! It is amazing, not to loud, and really gets the juice out of the fruits and vegetables. This is not my first juicer but is the best juicer by far. It is easy to put together, take apart, and clean. I am excited for the summer to get here so I can use it to make sherbet!
customer_reviews.author: Tee

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Love this juicer! Years ago, I bought a high speed juicer bc it was 1/3 the price. After about a year, it broke and I purchased a similar one. It didn't take a year for that one, nor for my THIRD one to burn up. Had I just bought this one, to begin with, I could have saved myself a lot of aggravation. I also love how quiet this one is, in comparison to the high speed juicers, easy to clean and that it doesn't generate heat to harm any delicate enzymes. It's also pretty enough to sit out on the counter.
customer_reviews.author: JillianTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this juicer. Efficient, so silly easy to use and clean. Worth every penny!! There is not one thing I am not impressed with. Buy this if you want a juicer...I do only green juices..so far...so only have experience in that vein.
customer_reviews.author: Maureen Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Just arrived, just juiced!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. It's simple to use. Assembly is really intuitive (except for the front nozzle cap which spins right to remove, it is marked though.) After rinsing the parts, grabbed some random fruits and veggies from the fridge and it had no problem munching through them. Easy to clean, really sturdy, and quiet. I'm quite pleased with this contraption. The only fault I found was I received double of the rectangular large noodle nozzle and only one of the round noodle nozzles. Going to contact the company about it. If there are any problems encountered, I'll be back, otherwise assume the company treated me well and I got what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: MarcoinMO

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed; purchased this juicer based on other reviews and have to say I will try to return to receive a replacement. The first two attempts at juicing turned out great; but, when I juiced five apples this morning all I got was applesauce and very little juice. When I turned on the juicer it was making a grinding noise along with the normal noise from the auger.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Smith

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Parts, Lots of Work, Lots of Juice
customer_reviews.text: I switched from a $500+ centrifugal juicer to this one. Its a lot more prep work to use and cleanup. But you get so much more juice from leafy greens and soft stuff like blueberries and etc. I'm definitely not getting rid of my other juicer though, its just a pain in the neck having to chop up most of the stuff I want to juice to get it through the cylindrical opening.
customer_reviews.author: Cool IT Guy '86

customer_reviews.title: Great work horse machine. Dose not waste. Really gets the liquid out of the item you are cold pressing.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a work horse. Just clean it right away and make sure the screen is clean between uses. We use it almost every day.
customer_reviews.author: tsmith154

customer_reviews.title: So glad I chose this juicer!
customer_reviews.text: I was really torn between this and the breville centrifugal. I had a centrifugal in the past and the oxidation of the juices (especially apple) was significant. This juicer is quiet, powerful, does a great job at extracting, and you can tell it is VERY well built. It's pretty enough to sit on the counter while I am doing a cleanse. Yes, the feed tube is a little small and reviews on that had me worried. Fact is, with an apple corer -- just about everything is easily chopped and fed through the tube. There's a plunger to help push stuff down, but often times the stuff just feeds itself. It's NO BIG DEAL. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: ggodzilla

customer_reviews.title: Excellent juicer-couldn't be more satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this juicer I read a lot of reviews and researched prices too. This one certainly seemed like a great value and to do everything I was looking for. I've not been disappointed! Here are some of my favorite features: -smaller than it looks (fits nicely on our kitchen countertops,even under the cupboards -easy to assemble -high quality parts -quiet -easy to take apart and clean-takes me only 2-3 minutes, and I do it before drinking the juice so nothing has a chance to dry up and stick It's an investment, but well worth the $$!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey B.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars4,705 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
